title: Absent Piers Morgan sparks fears he's been fired after missing start of GMB
text:

Piers Morgan sparked fear he had been fired this morning after missing the start of Wednesday's Good Morning Britain.

Susanna Reid thought the controversial petition to sack her co-host had succeeded when he wasn't in his seat when the cameras started rolling.

However, Piers frantically dashed into the studio in a nick of time and was ready at 6.01am.

Grinning Susanna joked: "For a moment there I thought the petition had succeeded."

Piers was forced to explain why he was running late - and it had nothing to do with the #FirePiers campaign.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

He explained: "This has really freaked me out and it might be a sign of ongoing problems. I was in my dressing room a few minutes ago. I was a bit tired this morning.

"I was doing my tie in the mirror and I thought 'I haven't shaved'. Every morning, shower, shave. I was like 'how can I forget to shave?'."

Piers realised he could not "get away" with a slight stubble and had to use an emergency electric razor.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Susanna said: "I thought we were going to start the programme without you here and people would think the petition to get rid of Piers Morgan had succeeded. But there were actually more signatures on the petition to save you."

Piers boasted that he was trending in US and UK and Susanna admitted it was only feeding his ego.

She advised: "If you hate Piers Morgan, the idea is not to make him trend over the world. He has an ego the size of the London Eye. A little tip from my book, I'e worked with him for a few years, ignore him. You'd do so much better."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Piers vowed that the haters would never get him taken off air and had actually boosted his salary.

He warned: "You're not going to get rid of me. I don't think they've really worked this through.

"They think making me trend worldwide for two days, making me the most talked about breakfast presenter in the world, will get rid of me.

"Let me tell you what you've done. You've helped me get a payrise. Cheers everybody."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Good Morning Britain viewers flocked to Twitter - with most backing the #SavePiers campaign.

One fan said: "They can't sack piers!!! My 7 year old thinks piers is brave and just talks the truth."

"If that petition would have succeeded then your show would no longer," added another.

A third said: "You can't fire #piersmorgan, he's the only one that makes it worth turning the TV on so early in the morning. Oh and Laura who does the weather."

"So we don't have to respect the will of the people!? Great! I look forward to seeing piers at the people's vote march on Saturday," said a fourth.

*Good Morning Britain airs weekdays on ITV at 6am
description: Susanna Reid thought the controversial petition to sack her Good Morning Britain co-host had succeeded
